section.section:
The Commission shall place the license of a real estate broker on inactive status if the real estate broker:
requests that the license of the broker be placed on inactive status; and
surrenders the license certificate and pocket card of the broker to the Commission.

The Commission shall place the license of an associate real estate broker or a real estate salesperson on inactive status if:
the associate broker or salesperson no longer is affiliated with the licensed real estate broker whose firm is named in the license certificate of the associate broker or salesperson; or
the associate broker or salesperson:
requests that the license of the associate broker or salesperson be placed on inactive status; and
surrenders the license certificate and pocket card of the associate broker or salesperson to the Commission.
A licensee whose license is on inactive status may not provide real estate brokerage services through that license.
The placement of a license on inactive status does not affect the power of the Commission to suspend or revoke the license or to take any other disciplinary action against the licensee.

text.section: Unless a license on inactive status is reactivated, the license expires 3 years after the date it is placed on inactive status.

section.section: Subject to paragraph (2) of this subsection, a licensee whose license is on inactive status remains responsible for renewing the license as required under § 17-314 of this subtitle.

Subject to the 3-year limitation under subsection (c) of this section, a licensee may renew a license while it is on inactive status if the licensee complies with the continuing education requirements of § 17-315 of this subtitle.

The Commission shall reactivate the license of a real estate broker that is on inactive status and reissue a license certificate and pocket card to the broker if the broker:
requests that the license be reactivated;
pays to the Commission a reissuance fee set by the Commission; and
meets the continuing education requirements that would have been required for renewal of a license under § 17-315 of this subtitle if the license had not been on inactive status.
